archimate:Device.name: Managed Switches (MSW)
archimate:Device.documentation:
Intended for use in data centers, network closets, IDF rooms, and key departmental hubs across the St. Jude Hospital campus, these switches will support connectivity for servers, wireless access points, IP phones, surveillance cameras, and other PoE devices. They must integrate seamlessly with the hospital’s virtualized, analytics-ready server infrastructure and provide secure, high-performance, and scalable switching for both critical and general-purpose network segments. Each switch must be fully managed and support advanced Layer 2 and Layer 3 features, Power over Ethernet (PoE+), and robust security controls. Switch type: Rack-mounted, fully managed Port count: Minimum 48 x 1G PoE+ ports with 4 x 10G SFP+ uplink ports : Modular stacking capability or built-in stacking ports PoE capability: IEEE 802.3af/at (PoE+) support on all access ports Total PoE budget: Minimum 740W (expandable via external power module if needed)
Performance:
• Switching capacity: Minimum 176 Gbps • Forwarding rate: Minimum 130 Mpps • MAC address table size: At least 32,000 entries • Latency: ≤ 5 microseconds for 1G packets
Layer 2 features:
• VLAN support (802.1Q) • STP/RSTP/MSTP • Link Aggregation (LACP) • IGMP snooping • Port isolation and mirroring
Layer 3 features:
• Static routing • RIP, OSPF (), and policy-based routing • DHCP snooping • Inter-VLAN routing • VRRP ()
Security features:
• 802.1X port-based authentication • Access Control Lists (ACLs) • Storm control • DHCP snooping • IP source guard • Secure management via SSH, HTTPS, and SNMPv3
Management and monitoring:
• Web GUI, CLI via SSH/console • SNMP v1/v2c/v3 • RADIUS/TACACS+ integration • Syslog and event logging • LLDP, CDP support • Zero-touch provisioning support ()
Redundancy and high availability:
• Dual redundant power supply support (hot-swappable, where available) • Stackable architecture (physical or virtual stacking) for high availability • Spanning Tree Protocol enhancements for fast convergence • Uplink failover
Environmental and physical:
• 1U rack-mountable • Operating temperature: 0°C to 45°C • Power supply: 100–240V AC, 50/60Hz auto-switching • Cooling: Front-to-back or side-to-side airflow (based on cabinet design) features: • Support for SDN integration (if part of future network upgrades) • Integration with centralized network management platform • Support for MACsec ( for critical segments)
Switches must be compatible with the hospital’s existing server environment (virtualized, analytics-ready, supporting EHR, HIS, and PACS workloads) and offer future scalability for IoT and AI-based applications.
